titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 372) to restore the application of the Federal antitrust laws to the business of health insurance to protect competition and consumers.
Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 372) to restore the application of the Federal antitrust laws to the business of health insurance to protect competition and consumers.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-50, by Mr. Collins (GA).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 372 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 22.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 209.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 185 (Roll no. 176).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 234 - 182 (Roll no. 177).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 372) to restore the application of the Federal antitrust laws to the business of health insurance to protect competition and consumers.
